source:
A private message system for users to send messages to each other. It has been written to be fully extendable using Drupal 8 APIs.

See the project page on Drupal.org for more details.
A private message system for users to send messages to each other
Ajax refresh rate: Ajax refresh disabled
Allows administrators to administer private messages
Allows administrators to manage all parts of the One Page Private Message module
Allows users to send and receive private messages
Amount of time after leaving a thread that the system starts sending notifications of new messages
Are you sure you want to delete all private message content from the system?
Are you sure you want to delete the thread between you and the following users: @others?
target: Möchten Sie die Konversation zwischen Ihnen und folgenden Benutzern: @others wirklich löschen?

source: Deleting private message data. Completed: @percentage% (@current of @total).
Displays a link to send a private message to the node author
Displays a link to send a private message to the profile owner
Displays a link to send a private message to the user
Displays members using the %display_mode display mode of the user entity
Displays members using their username, linked to the user account if the viewer has permission to access user profiles
Displays the last message in the thread
Displays the username, linked to the user profile if the viewer has permission to access user profiles
Do not send notifications (users can opt-in)
Global settings for the Private Message module
Hide recipient field when recipient is in the URL
If this box is checked, the text formats description on the private message form will be removed
Key that sends the message when pressed
Links can be created to the private message page, passing the recipient in the URL. If this box is checked, the recipient field will be hidden when the recipient is passed in the URL.
Maximum number of members that can be added.
Number of threads to load with ajax
Number of threads to show on load: @count
Number of threads to show when clicking load previous: @count
Only when not viewing the thread
Only when the user is not viewing the thread
Prepare the private message module for uninstallation
Private message data has been deleted.
Private message thread member widget settings
Private message thread members formatter settings
Private message thread message formatter settings
Private messages threads cannot have more than @count members
Proceeding will delete all private messages and private message threads in your system. They cannot be recovered. Do you wish to proceed?
Remove the default CSS of the module
Send notifications of new messages in a thread
Settings for the private message inbox block
Settings for the private message notifications block
Text to submit a new message
The ID of the private message
The ID of the private message thread
The URL of the individual private message. Use the URL token of the private message thread to link to the conversation
The author of the private message
The custom private message thread UUID.
The date at which the message was posted
The date at which the thread was last updated
The form to create a new message
The keys allowed to press to send directly the message.
The label of the action to create private message
The label of the button to send a new message.
The link to delete the thread
The link to the private message thread
The maximum number of members that can be added to the private message conversation. Set to zero (0) to allow unlimited members
The member(s) of the private message thread
The members list is prefixed with the text: %members_prefix.
The members list is shown without a prefix
The most recent time at which the thread was updated
The notice that there are no active users
The notification from a private message
The number of messages to display on load
The number of messages to load when the load previous button is clicked
The number of messages to show on load
The number of previous messages to load using ajax when clicking the load previous link
The number of seconds after a user has accessed a thread, after which they should be considered as not viewing the thread anymore
The number of seconds after which a user should be considered as not viewing a thread

The number of seconds after which the inbox should refresh itself. Setting this to a low number will result in more requests to the server, adding overhead and bandwidth. Setting this number to zero will disable ajax refresh, and the inbox will only updated if/when the page is refreshed.
The number of seconds between ajax checks for new messages

The number of seconds between checks for new messages. Set to zero to disable. Note that a lower number will cause more requests, use more bandwidth, and cause more strain on the server. As such, it is not recommended to set a value lower than five (5) seconds.

The number of seconds between checks to see if there are any new messages. Setting this to a low number will result in more requests to the server, adding overhead and bandwidth. Setting this number to zero will disable ajax refresh, and the inbox will only updated if/when the page is refreshed.
The number of threads to be loaded when the load previous link is clicked
The number of threads to be shown in the block
The order in which private messages should be shown, ascending or descending

The private message module cannot be uninstalled if there is private message content in the database. Clicking the button below will delete all private message content from the system, allowing the module to be uninstalled.
The private messages that belong to this thread
The raw body of the private message
The time that the private message was created.
The view mode used to render private messages
The widget to add members to the private message thread

This field allows you to set up some keys that will send the message instead of pressing the submit button. Just enter the KeyboardEvent.key or the deprecated KeyboardEvent.keyCode for compatibility. You can separate entrees by a comma in order to support multiple keys. This feature doesn't work with wysiwyg, you have to use a simple textarea as a text editor.
This option allows you to put the autofocus in the message textarea.
This option can break the features of the module and it is only for developers who want to override the styles more easily.
This will delete all private message content from the database. Are you absolutely sure you wish to proceed?
Tokens related to private message threads
Various configuration settings for the Private Messages module
target: Verschiedene Konfigurationen der Einstellungen des privaten Nachrichten Modules

source: When users have a private message thread open, calls to the server update the last time they have accessed the thread. This setting determines how many seconds after they have closed the thread, they should be considered as not accessing the thread anymore. Users will be able to override this value on their profile settings page.
Whether notifications should be sent while the user is on the private message page.
Whether or not notifications should be sent when the user is viewing a given thread. Users will be able to override this value on their profile settings page.
Whether or not notifications should be sent when you are viewing a thread
Whether or not the message autofocus feature is enabled.
Whether or not to hide the filter tips on the message form
Whether or not to hide the recipient field when a recipient is passed through the URL
Whether or not to remove the default CSS styles
Whether the module should offer the option to send notifications
Whether to send notifications by default. Users will be able to alter this behavior in their profiles
Whether to show messages first to last, or last to first
You can not send a message because there are inactive users selected for this thread.
You can not send a message because there are no active users left in this thread.
You do not have any messages
You do not have any private messages
You have no unread private messages

[user:display-name],

You have received a private message at [site:name] from [private_message:author-name]

The message is as follows:

[private_message:message]

You can view the entire thread and reply to this message at:

[private_message_thread:url]


Thank you,

-- [site:name]
